data.meta_description: Here are 30 difficult and quirky names of movies for dumb charades game that will ensure your win among your friends. Check out the full list.
data.text:
Nearly every Desi who finds themselves with some leisure time and nothing specific to engage in has likely participated in the game of dumb charades, commonly referred to as Dumsharaz.

What is Dumb Charades and how is it played?

Dumb Charades is a guessing game in which people are divided into teams.

One team member gives a movie’s name and one person from the opposite team acts out the film without uttering a word.

The opposite team has to then guess the film’s name in a limited amount of time.

Each of us holds at least one recollection linked to this activity, whether from social gatherings, rides on school buses, idle school periods, work breaks, or any family wedding celebration alongside cousins.

30 Most Difficult Dumb Charades Movies Names for the Perfect Game

1. Matru Ki Bijlee Ka Mandola

This satirical film starred Imran Khan, Anushka Sharma, and Pankaj Kapoor in the lead roles.

Matru Ki Bijlee Ka Mandola was directed by Vishal Bhardwaj and tells the story of a village, where the power game is at its peak and, amid all this chaos, a love story is on the verge of sacrifice.

2. Andheri Raat Mein Diya Tere Haath Mein

This B-grade Bollywood film was directed and headlined by Dada Kondke and also starred Amjad Khan and Usha Chavan in the lead roles.

Anderi Raat Mein Diya Tere Haath Mein was released in 1986.

3. Allah Meherban To Gadha Pehalwan

This forgettable film starred Kader Khan, Shakti Kapoor, Zahid Ali, and Kulbhushan Kharbanda in the lead roles.

Allah Meherban to Gadha Pehalwan was released in 1997.

4. Jis Desh Mein Ganga Rehta Hai

This 2000 drama was directed by Mahesh Manjrekar.

Jis Desh Mein Ganga Rehta Hai tells the story of a naive village boy who struggles to fit into the modern urban lifestyle.

This film starred Govinda and Sonali Bendre in the lead roles and was a remake of a Marathi film called Ekta Jeev Sadashiv by Govind Kulkarni.

5. Ajab Prem Ki Ghazab Kahani

This 2009 romantic comedy was directed by Rajkumar Santoshi and starred Ranbir Kapoor and Katrina Kaif in the lead roles.

Ajab Prem Ki Ghazab Kahani told the story of a lazy bachelor who falls in love with a Catholic girl, only to find out that she loves someone else!

6. Sonu Ke Titu Ki Sweety

This bromantic comedy showcases a war between a gold digger fiancee and a guy who wants to save his friend from her.

Sonu Ke Titu Ki Sweety was directed by Luv Ranjan and stars Kartik Aaryan, Nushrratt Bharuccha, and Sunny Singh in the lead roles.

7. Haseena Maan Jaayegi

This 1999 David Dhawan film starred Sanjay Dutt, Govinda, Karisma Kapoor, and Pooja Batra in the lead roles.

8. Detective Byomkesh Bakshy!

This detective thriller is directed by Dibakar Banerjee and stars Sushant Singh Rajput, Anand Tiwari, and Swastika Mukherjee in the lead roles.

9. Paap Ko Jalaakar Raakh Kar Doonga

This mass entertainer had an ensemble cast including Dharmendra, Govinda, Anita Raj, Farah Naaz, Tanuja, and Kulbhushan Kharbanda in the lead roles.

10. Manorama Six Feet Under

This 2007 underrated thriller was directed by Navdeep Singh and stars Abhay Deol, Raima Sen, and Gul Panag in the lead roles.

11. Bhavesh Joshi Superhero

This vigilante thriller was directed by Vikramaditya Motwane and has become a cult film now.

Bhavesh Joshi Superhero stars Harshvarshan Kapoor in the lead roles.

12. Ram Teri Ganga Maili

This cult film was directed by Raj Kapoor and questioned the corruption in the system.

The film starred Mandakini and Rajiv Kapoor in the lead roles.

13. Hello! Hum Lallan Bol Rahe Hain

This aspirational love story features Rajpal Yadav and Preeti Mehra in the lead roles.

14. Arvind Desai Ki Ajeeb Dastaan

Arvind Desai Ki Ajeeb Dastaan showcases a delusional love story between a rich man’s son, his wife, and his secretary.

Arvind Desai Ki Ajeeb Dastaan stars Saeed Akhtar Mirza in the lead role.

15. Murde Ki Jaan Khatre Mein

This 1985 film was directed by Naveen Kumar and features Sudhir Dalvi, Kunal Kapoor, and Paintal in the lead roles.

16. Qayamat Se Qayamat Tak

Qayamat Se Qayamat Tak was the debut film of Aamir Khan, which was directed by Manssor Khan.

This film also starred Juhi Chawla in the lead role.

17. Miss Tanakpur Haazir Ho

This 2015 political satire was directed by Vinod Kapri and starred Annu Kapoor, Om Puri, Ravi Kisan, and Rahul Bagga in the lead roles.

18. Mere Dad Ki Maruti

This lighthearted film by Ashima Chibber is a perfect example of ‘comedy in chaos.’

Mere Dad Ki Maruti stars Saqib Saleem, Rhea Chakraborty, and Ram Kapoor in the lead roles.

19. Jajantaram Mamantaram

This fantasy drama stars Jaaved Jaffrey and Gulshan Grover in the lead roles.

Jajantaram Mamantaram is the remake of Gulliver’s Travels.

20. Bhuj: The Pride Of India

The title of this film might appear small, but it will definitely confuse your opponents.

Bhuj is a patriotic mass entertainer, starring Ajay Devgn, Nora Fatehi, Sanjay Dutt, and Sonakshi Sinha in the lead roles.

21. Tees Maar Khan

This comedy film is directed by Farah Khan and stars Akshay Kumar and Katrina Kaif in the lead roles.

22. Luv Shuv Tey Chicken Khurana

This Sameer Sharma directorial starred Kunal Kapoor and Huma Qureshi in the lead roles and tells the story of a guy who deceives a gangster in London and comes back to India to revive his family restaurant.

23. Udhar Ka Sindur

This 1976 drama stars Jeetendra, Reena Roy, and Asha Parekh in the lead roles.

Udhar Ka Sindur was directed by Chander Vohra.

24. Zulm O Sitam

This 1998 K.C. Bokadia film had an ensemble star cast of Dharmendra

Shatrughan Sinha, Jaya Prada, Arjun Sarja, Madhoo, Mukesh Khanna, and Danny Denzongpa.

25. 36 China Town
